qas.question: When was homosexuality legalized in Bermuda?

answers.text: The OBA government simultaneously introduced a bill to permit Civil Unions

qas.question: What did the Chief Justice decide?

answers.text: same sex spouses of Bermuda citizens could not be denied basic Human Rights.

qas.question: What happened due to the Stubbs Bill in February 1994?

plausible_answers.text: amend the Human Rights Act of Bermuda to disallow Same Sex Marriage under the Act

qas.question: What did Wayne Kawaley wish to do in 2016?

plausible_answers.text: simultaneously introduced a bill to permit Civil Unions

qas.question: What did the OAB government do in 2016?

plausible_answers.text: that same sex spouses of Bermuda citizens could not be denied basic Human Rights

qas.question: What did Hon Mr. Justice Ian Furbert's earlier ruling state?

context: <b3_0>Homosexuality was decriminalised in Bermuda<b3_0/> with the passage of the Stubbs Bill in <a0_0>May 1994.<a0_0/> Legislation was introduced by Private Members Bill by PLP MP Wayne Furbert to <b4_0>amend the Human Rights Act of Bermuda to disallow Same Sex Marriage under the Act<b4_0/> in February 2016. <a1_0>The OBA government <b5_0>simultaneously introduced a bill to permit Civil Unions<b5_0/><a1_0/>. Both measures were in response to a decision by His Hon Mr. Justice Ian Kawaley, Chief Justice of Bermuda's earlier ruling <b6_0>that <a2_0>same sex spouses of Bermuda citizens could not be denied basic Human Rights<b6_0/>.
